intro: Laseguea erecta var. scabrinervia, commonly known as the rough-veined laseguea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with prominently veined, rough textures. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique foliage and modest flowering, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of rare plants.
